text: Are you referring to when sending a post request to <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token>?

when requesting a token, send a post request with content type application/x-www-form-urlencoded body to <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token> â€¦ body comprised of : grant_type=authorization_code&redirect_uri=your-redirect-uri(same as the one you set up in auth tab of developer console/app settings under redirect URL)&code=yourcode&client_id=yourclientid&client_secret=yourclientsecret

Not sure where to put this... I'll try here first. We had an issue arise for a client yesterday who uses Round Robin meeting types for a few HubSpot Meeting Links. A user who was configured on those round robin meetings was deactivated (the person left the company) but HubSpot didn't remove that user from the Round Robin assignment and instead kept trying to schedule meetings on that persons calendar (because they looked completely available). Has anyone run into this bug before? HubSpot needs to have a check in their logic to exclude any deactivated user from Round Robin meeting assignment.
